title: Stay at the world's tiniest boutique boltholes for total exclusivity
text:
17 shares 2
View
comments
It's true what they say: Size doesn't always matter.
In fact, when it comes to these beautiful boutique hotels, their smaller square footage is synonymous with a more personalised, luxurious stay.
Whether you're looking for a city break above a quaint Copenhagen cafe or a relaxing weekend away in a dramatic Moroccan riad, there is a stunning small property for every occasion.
Here, MailOnline Travel picks the best micro hotels around the globe.
Scroll down for video
In Rome's trendy Trastevere district, the three-room Buonanotte Garibaldi hotel is ideally located
Buonanotte Garibaldi, Rome
In the Trastevere district of the Italian capital, this stunning three-room hotel is ideally located for sightseers looking for a bit of privacy.
The quaint property is just a 15 minute walk from the Pantheon and is run by an artist who's parents owned the villa in the 1960s.

Come on in, the water's freezing! Daredevil holidaymakers... 17 shares Unsurprisingly, guests should expect every room to be decorated with interesting art pieces.
And for those who are especially interested in learning more, you can even visit the owner's studio, which is located nearby.
Run by an artist, each room unsurprisingly contains plenty of unique pieces - and you can even visit the owner's studio
In the stylish drawing room, visitors can relax alongside a grand piano and plenty of art books
The two bedrooms on the ground directly open up to the picturesque courtyard, while the third room, which is on the floor above, has a private terrace.
In the stylish drawing room, visitors can relax alongside a grand piano - or take a peek at one of the many art books stocked on the shelves.
Doubles start at just £147 per night.
Central Hotel and Café, Copenhagen
At Copenhagen's Central Hotel and Cafe, one bedroom is available atop a quirky coffee shop
Hotels don't get much smaller than this.
The one-bedroom hotel is located in the trendy Vesterbro neighbourhood of Copenhagen, above a similarly tiny coffee shop, which is owned and operated by the same people.
The building dates back to the 1800s - it used to belong to a shoemaker - and though it's been renovated, plenty of interesting antiques and quaint details remain.
Booking is available from £170 per night.
Casas del XVI, Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
Casas del XVI in Santo Domingo has only seven suites spread across the property's two casas
For those staying in one of the seven suites in the property's two casas, there is no doubt that you will make you feel as pampered as the Spanish royal family who once inhabited this 16th-century city.
Now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Santo Domingo's Colonial City was the site of the first permanent European settlement in the New World.
Best of all, the crumbling ruins and stunning cathedrals are all within a 20 minute walk from the hotel.
Located in the Colonial City, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the luxurious property offers plenty of extravagant touches, like your own butler (known as a mayordomo)
Dining options are relatively limited - though breakfast is offered daily. Lunches and dinners can be prepared on request, simply ask your butler.
Yes, all rooms are assigned an English-speaking butler (known as a mayordomo), who can assist in planning your meals, excursions, in-room spa treatments or even a personal training session.
WiFi is available throughout the property and iPhones will be lent out to visitors who ask.
While each room offers a unique aesthetic, only those staying in the luxury suites in Casa de los Mapas have access to the private pool.
Superior rooms are currently available for just £168 per night.
Follonico, Tuscany, Italy
The four-star Follonico bed and breakfast offers an idyllic starting point from which to explore Tuscany
Follonico is known for the eccentric decor and funky aesthetic in each of it's six rooms
This four-star bed and breakfast is an idyllic starting point from which to explore the gorgeous Tuscan countryside.
The property's eccentric decor and eclectic aesthetic make each of the six rooms delightfully quirky and unique.
But keep in mind that amenities are relatively basic - there's no on-site restaurant, for example - so you'll want to take advantage of the nearby towns of Montefollonico and Montepulciano.
Nearby, the towns of Montefollonico and Montepulciano offer eateries and plenty of local wine
There's no on-site restaurant, but there is a breakfast room where a locally-sourced spread is laid out daily
There is, however, the option to book a cooking class. (Simply let the owners know ahead of time.)
And in the breakfast room, where a locally-sourced continental spread is laid out each morning, an honesty bar is stocked with beer, soft drinks and several local wines.
A bit further afield, the hilltop town of Siena is home to many galleries, restaurants and museums. However, you'll likely be so charmed by the Italian countryside, you may prefer the nearby Renaissance towns and sprawling greenery.
Rates start at £115.
Dar Darma, Marrakech, Morocco
Dar Darma, located in Marrakech's popular Medina quarter, is a quirky, opulent private residence
There are five suites in total on the property, including two apartments, as well as a homely hammam
Boasting five suites, including two apartments, this private residence is as quirky as it is stunning.
Situated in the city's Medina quarter, Dar Darma's aesthetic can best be described as Versace meets museum and is complete with plenty of one-of-a-kind antiques.
And it's entirely personal - the riad is rented out as a holiday home that you 'borrow,' complete with staff.
As well as a courtyard and rooftop terrace, there's also a plunge pool, library and plenty of outdoor dining space
However, if you'd like to book a treatment, you'll need to give the staff a few hours' warning to heat up the water
While the souks are nearby and a bustling restaurant ideally located across the street, there's also plenty to occupy you with inside the home.
There's a courtyard, roof terrace with plunge pool, library and even a homely hammam - but you'll need to give staff a few hours' warning when requesting a treatment.
Likewise, you'll need to decide a few hours in advance if you'd like the housekeeper to prepare a French or Moroccan dinner for you on any given night, though you may be surprised by musicians who will offer an evening serenade.
Coqui Coqui Merida, Merida, Mexico
Coqui Coqui Merida is a one-room, colonial townhouse, complete with white-washed rooms and marble floors
With white-washed rooms and vintage marble floors, this colonial-era townhouse will transport you back in time.
Considered to be more of private residence than a hotel, the home has only one suite - and it sits above Coqui Coqui's Perfumeria and boutique, in the centre of Merida's Centro Historico.
But that doesn't mean there aren't plenty of high-end amenities to choose from, including spa treatments, roof terrace, and two claw-footed tubs - perfect for booking a botanical spa bath.
Downstairs, the Coqui Coqui Perfumeria is housed, along with a boutique, in Merida's Centro Historico
The upstairs suite has a private balcony, rooftop terrace and two claw-foot tubs - perfect for an in-room spa
The airy decor provides the perfect retreat after a day exploring the nearby Dzibilchaltun Mayan ruins.
Following a morning of sight-seeing, the room's private balcony and rooftop sun-loungers are both good options to soak up some afternoon sun.
Rates are available upon request and also usually include a personalised breakfast, bottled water and a gift from the perfumery.
Anopura, Jaipur, India
Designed as a country house surrounded by farmlands, Anopura near Jaipur, is anything but basic
Designed as a country house, surrounded by farmlands, this property is anything but basic.
Guests can opt to stay in one of two luxurious suites - or, if you're feeling adventurous, the property's equally as opulent Rajasthani tent.
It's just an hour drive from Jaipur, nestled in the Aravali mountains, but with the attentive staff, gorgeous gardens and stone plunge pool, you may not want to leave the Ramgarh Valley.
Rates are available upon request.
